boardgame.name: Here I Stand
Here I Stand: Wars of the Reformation 1517-1555
boardgame.description: Here I Stand: Wars of the Reformation 1517-1555 is the first game in over 25 years to cover the political and religious conflicts of early 16th Century Europe. Few realize that the greatest feats of Martin Luther, John Calvin, Ignatius of Loyola, Henry VIII, Charles V, Francis I, Suleiman the Magnificent, Ferdinand Magellan, Hern_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;aacute;n Cort_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;s, and Nicolaus Copernicus all fall within this narrow 40-year period of history. This game covers all the action of the period using a unique card-driven game system that models both the political and religious conflicts of the period on a single point-to-point map._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;There are six main powers in the game, each with a unique path to victory:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; The Ottomans_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; The Habsburgs_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; The English_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; The French_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; The Papacy_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; The Protestants_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Here I Stand is the first card-driven game to prominently feature secret deal-making. A true six-sided diplomatic struggle, the game places a heavy emphasis on successful alliance-building through negotiations that occur away from the table during the pre-turn Diplomacy Phase. Set during the period in which Niccol_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ograve; Machiavelli published his masterpiece _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;The Prince,_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; backstabbing is always possible, especially because the card deck is loaded with event and response cards that can be played by any power to disrupt the plans of the powers in the lead._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Here I Stand integrates religion, politics, economics, and diplomacy in a card-driven design. Games vary in length from 3_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash;4 hours for a tournament scenario up to full campaign games that run about twice the time. Rules to play games with 3, 4, or 5 players are also included. The 3-player game is just as well balanced as the standard 6-player configuration, taking advantage of the natural alliances of the period._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Description: Here I Stand: Wars of the Reformation 1517-1555 is the first game in over 25 years to cover the political and religious conflicts of early 16th Century Europe. Few realize that the greatest feats of Martin Luther, Jean Calvin, Ignatius Loyola, Henry VIII, Charles V, Francis I, Suleiman the Magnificent, Ferdinand Magellan, Hernando Cortes, and Nicolaus Copernicus all fall within this narrow 40-year period of history. This game covers all the action of the period using a unique card-driven game system that models both the political and religious conflicts of the period on a single point-to-point map.
Here I Stand revolves around secret deal-making and a true six-sided diplomatic stuggle which places heavy emphasis on successful alliance-building and negotations occuring away from the table during the pre-turn Diplomacy Phase. In true Machiavellian style, backstabbing is always possible and the card deck is loaded with event and response cards that can be played by any power to disrupt the plans of the powers in the lead.
Contents: Four full-color counter sheets One 22_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; x 34_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; full-color mapsheet 110 Strategy cards Ten 6-sided dice 32-page Rulebook 24-page Campaign Manual Six 8.5_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; x 5.5_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; Power Cards Two Player Aid Cards (two-sided) Game Features ******************************** Our Philosophy: We are not satisfied unless you are satisfied! It_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s that simple. In business for over 5 years, we understand the most critical aspects of ecommerce. You will receive a price quote for each shipping option and you choose which of these two shipping option best fits your needs. All shipments are made within 2-3 days of receiving your cleared PayPal payment. Note: feel free to combine items to reduce shipping cost. Returns: Our return policy mirrors our philosophy; we are not satisfied unless you are satisfied! You may return any unopened item within 30 days of delivery for a full refund of the purchase price less shipping costs. Simply contact us to make return arrangements. Note: if an item is damaged in transit, an item exchange will be made at no additional cost to the buyer. Note that we take special pains to package all of your items properly but in the event of the unforeseen, we have you covered!
